intro: Pfaffia grandiflora var. typica, commonly known as curaçao root, is a perennial herb native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its roots are the primary part used, valued for their purported medicinal properties. Pfaffia grandiflora var. typica thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it adaptable to tropical and subtropical climates.
